user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Damn I like this beer. Sampled at the Map Room in Chicago. Fresh, citrus hops attack the nose luring you into the first blissful sip. Splendid malty backbone over which a blanket of hops has been scattered. Many IPA/APAs are more bitter. None impress me as much as this.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A refreshingly bitter lager. Starts out bitter and hoppy and that carries through to a dry bitter finish. An ale drinkers lager.
beer_name: Les Trois Mousquetaires MIM 2006 - Ryan Allen, MacAllen Pils

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: An excellent lager with a full mouthfeel and good bitterness. The finish is a little harsh, but all in all a solid effort.
beer_name: Grand River Galt Knife Old Style Lager

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A very solid ale. Hops are most evident in the mouth. A little more aroma would be beneficial. A fine addition to the Ontario craft brewing scene.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A nice surprise. I ordered this not knowing it was an A-B beer. Good alternative to the Guinness we get in North America.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A very nice APA with good a good hop bite. Fresh on draught, it was very refreshing and flavourful. I could drink this all night.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Very unique beer. Lots of Vanillin from the wood , a milky like flavour as well that reminds me of malo-lactic chardonnays.
beer_name: Bluegrass Jeffersons Reserve Bourbon Barrel Stout

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: An acidic beginning gives way to a beautiful malt backbone. Nice caramel touches throughout. Id drink this again.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: An excellent dark wheat beer that combines the traditional cloves and bananas with a hint of chocolate. Well balanced and satisfying.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A well made if uninspiring pils. Tastes like many other German variations on this style.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: An excellent Zwickel beer in an old fashioned style. Good balance, and excellent colour.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A wonderful Maibock with a hint of smoked malt flavour. Modeerately bitter and full bodied. My favorite brew from this brewery

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A nice round, malty beer. Could use more carbonation and balance. Somewhat cloudy appearance.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Pours a lovely brown, with orange hints at the edges.  Aroma is pure chocolate, with little cherry aroma evident.  Mouthfeel is nice, but could use just a little more body.  Flavour is well balanced with cherries in the background. A tough beer to brew, as fruit, esp. cherries are a delicate balancing act.  Nicely done.
beer_name: Black Oak Double Chocolate Cherry Stout

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Hmmm, this one tastes as thoughit should be sold in a 40 ounce bottle.  Very Olde English 800.  Sweet and alcoholic, adjunct noticeable.  Little or no hop presence.  Serve ICE cold with freshly BBQd roadkill and the Johnnies under the train bridge will love it.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A great addition to Black Oaks seasonal line-up. Lively and yeasty with a splash of orange zest.  Estery aroma and hazy unfiltered appearance.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: What balls!  A beer flavoured with white pepper? A real eye-opener, full of contrasting flavours and aromas.  Not subtle. Only drawback is that I probably could only drink one pint of this per evening, its that intense.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Tasted like skunky Carling Black Label (Canada).  Maybe its not imported from Brazil, but bottled in Canada for the domestic market?  Corn water with a spray of the skunk. Bad.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Not one of Phil Goachers better efforts.  Alcohol very up-front and noticeable, sweet malt and boozy feel about it. Unbalanced.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A very good strong ale, brewed in the "northern fashion".  It does remind me of Old Peculier more now that amsterdam is brewing it.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A lovely winter warmer full of rich, dark malt notes. malty middle and drying finish.  A lovely strong mild/old ale

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A tasty enough ale with a deep brown head.  A sweet, aromatic aroma leads to a rather sweet, flavour almost balanced by hops.  Smells like some flavoured coffees I've had at the Second Cup.  A very good beer, if a tad on the gimmicky side.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: An entry level Hefe.  A little bananas and cream with a hint of cloves as well. Thin body.  Michael Hancock at Denison's need not lose sleep over this.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: More of a porter than a stout, at least in body. Toasty with coffee (espresso) notes.  Lacks mouthfeel and finish.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A nicely hopped pale ale with a good malt background. Grassy and grainy in the nose, with a spicy hit of hops. Satisfying.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A real beatiful dark ale.  Coffee and cinnamon with a hint of nuts in the mix.  Bring on Christmas!

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A very nice brown ale with a rich malt character.  Nuts and roast malt combine with a moderate dose of hops to produce a satisfying package. Well done.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A very macro beer from a well financed micro.  Very little in the way of hops to justify the pilsner moniker.  Overall, light, quaffable and undistinguished.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A decent quaffable red ale. Good aftertaste and mouthfeel. Good grain and hop balance throughout.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: This one has a little more hop in the mouth and in the nose.  Not a great beer, but the best from this producer.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A much better effort than their flagship IPA. Fuller bodied, with a very slight wheat flavour and aroma.  Not bang on for the style, but at least its an effort.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A macro lager with a little flavour to it.  If there's Saaz hops in it, I can't really find them. A good alternative to Blue.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: O'Keefe's old lager.  Fruity and carbonic with little in the way of mouthfeel or hops.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Macro beer at its...well its wet, and it will quench your thirst on a hot day.  The case announces boldly that it is made with the finest malt and CORN.  At least they're honest.Sweet, perfumy and light with a slight trailing bitterness.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: It's an IPA like Alexnader Keith's is...in name only. No real hop flavour or aroma to speak of, just a pale bland beer with no aftertaste.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: I remember drinking this in the 70's when it was (along with Labatt's Gold Keg) the only non-porter/stout that had any colour to it.  It was passable then, now the colour is all its got.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Not the Black Horse Ale that I remember drinking as a teenager!  Now a lager, with much of the bitterness and body stripped away.  Just a mainstream Canadian brew.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Dominion Ale is in fact a lager and has been for over twenty years.  Its still a very palatable beer and one Molson should "export" to the rest of Canada instead of the Rickard's line of crap.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A grand smoked porter. Big peaty, smokey flavours over a full, round chocolate body. Very robust. Drinks lighter than its alcohol suggests. Lovers of smoked beers should try this one!

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A beautiful ale from Cheriton. The elderflowers underpin the hops in a way that is quite remarkable. Great spice and aroma. A multi-award winning beer, with good reason.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A very good rendition of the Vienna style of lager. Red in colour, with a bright white head, this beer blends complex malty character with a drier finish. Very Good.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A nicely hopped Brwon Ale. Very complex aromas of chocolate and coffee combine with the hops to yield a great drinking experience.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A very good beer. Full-bodied, in keeping with its deep copper colour. A wallop of hops and enough malt to keep things on track. If had on draught, it can really sneak up on you!

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: An excellent example of American-Style IPA's. Big Hop nose, full-body,interesting  citrus and malt combo.Bitter finish. A real treasure.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: An entry level Rauchbier, with a subdued smoke flavour. If this is too much for you, stay away from Aechte Schlerkerla Marzen. Nice malt though, and an overall easy drinking smoked beer.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: So, this is a beer? There is little beer flavour to commend it. Still, what flavour it does have is not objectionable. Maybe they could spend what they saved on the can graphics to add some flavour!

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A gimmicky beer that combines X.O. Cognac(? with a standard lager. The result is underwhelming. The beer is sweet and the Cognac adds the taste of cheap alcohol. The ruination of two fine beverages.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: Amber-red in colour, this beer uses a portion of smoked whisky malt to give it an interesting aroma. The beer overall is too sweet, with the finish being far too short.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A flavourful brown beer. Strong and malty sweet with some chocolate notes. Too light to be a true porter.

user_location: of Scotch Irish Brewing Company Fitzroy Harbour, Ontario, Canada
review_blob: A very ordinary beer from Artois. Light, thin, malty. No better than Stella, but with upmarket pretensions.
